properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant Rainfall for Northeastern BC This Weekend. A series of disturbances will move through northern BC bringing periods of moderate to heavy rainfall tonight through Monday. Potential impacts for this event include rising rivers and destabilizing slopes. An already moist air mass will be enhanced by upslope flow, particularly on the east slopes of the Northern Rockies. The communities of Liard River, Muncho Lake, Toad River, Nelson Forks, Sikanni Chief and their surrounding higher terrain may see up to 50 to 80 mm of total rainfall. These areas have experienced moderate rainfall events over the past few weeks thus the ground is quite saturated in some places. Stay tuned to your local weather forecast and alerts: www.weather.gc.ca Flood Warnings and Advisories can be viewed at: http://bcrfc.env.gov.bc.ca/warnings/index.htm Road Conditions: https://drivebc.ca/ ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-06T17:18:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-06T01:19:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0874320657.2020
Area: B.C. South Peace River, B.C. North Peace River, Fort Nelson
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 1:03 a.m. CST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Fast-moving water across a road can sweep a vehicle away. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-06-06T11:02:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-06T07:03:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3634252892.2020
Area: R.M. of Val Marie including Val Marie Orkney and Monchy, R.M. of Mankota including Mankota and Ferland, R.M. of Waverley including Glentworth and Fir Mountain
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Escaped Prisoner From Northeast Nova Scotia Correctional Facility
properties.Summary:
Description: An inmate has escaped from the Northeast Correctional Facility in Pictou County, Nova Scotia at approximately 8:30 pm tonight. Kevin Edward Clarke-McNeil is incarcerated on serious criminal charges including Attempted Murder. Do not contact or approach Clarke-McNeil, call 911 or local police. Clarke-McNeil may attempt to return to the Halifax area. Described as a 5-foot-8 white male, 200 pounds, long brown curly hair and a large beard, last seen wearing no shirt and grey jogging pants.
Expires: 2020-06-06T23:45:00-03:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Nova Scotia Emergency Management Office, 2020-06-05T23:57:32-03:00, DBDEE383-33D7-8427-69D8-C62BD39C25A2
Area: Antigonish County, Colchester County, Cumberland County, Halifax Regional Municipality, Hants County and Pictou County.
properties.Author: Nova Scotia Emergency Management Office

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Severe thunderstorms are possible early Saturday morning as a system from Montana moves toward southern Saskatchewan. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-06T17:12:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-06T08:14:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1433984827.2020
